column3: @Diapolo what is that repository by comparison?  Why can't it be merged here? \nI don't see any notes RE the above in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin#development-process,  so please forgive me if I've missed something.\n

@dcousens Please don't comment on multiple issues asking the same question; it just results in email spam.. The trivial next repository was set up to handle trivial code changes and to try keep some of the "noise" out of the main repository.\n

@fanquake sure.  I removed the superfluous comment in #6543.
There is no mention of that process in the `README`,  is it listed somewhere officially?

Also,  if they are legitimate fixes,  why not just merge any way?
If you want to limit the number of "trivial" commits,  why not use a branch [in this repository] and just merge it after some cap of trivial commits has been reached?
It seems re

@dcousens The repo is still somewhat experimental. It's had some traffic, and been merged back into the main repository at least three time now, see #6135, #6004 and the original merge in #5731. Given that we're pointing people to it we probably should mention it in the documentation. Feel free to submit a pull request (to the main repo) to add some notes. \n\nUsing a separate branch in this repos
ACK.\nBut should go over @theuni s trivial branch.\n
@fanquake the joys of a monolithic code base. \nShall we put it in the README?\n
Just going to merge this now. But yes we should get the trivial branch running again @theuni, please submit there next time.\n
